definition: classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: Two-tone facias are dark at the top and light lower down to increase the sensation of light and space.
sentences.chinese: 雙音令狀是黑的頂部和低光下，以增加光線和空間感。

sentences.english: I believe these need to be protected with a warrant requirement.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲這些信息也應該受到令狀申請的保護。

sentences.english: A writ was the document necessary to start an action in a royal court.
sentences.chinese: 令狀是在王室法院提起訴訟所必需的一種文件。

sentences.english: Writs were obtained from the Chancery Writ Office, a department of state.
sentences.chinese: 令狀是從文祕署處獲得，那是一個獨立的國家機關。

definition: to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
